Authors:
Sabina Donadio, Marcela Viviana Nicola, M. Amalia
Scataglini, Raul Pozner
Title:
A new species of Mastigostyla from Argentina (Iridoideae,
Iridaceae)
Abstract:
We describe and illustrate Mastigostyla coronata, a new
species of Iridaceae from the high Andes of Jujuy (Argentina),
morphologically related to Mastigostyla vargasii. The inclusion of this
new species in Mastigostyla is supported by a phylogenetic analysis
based on plastid markers. We also present a morphological comparison
among the sub-acaulescent species of Mastigostyla (including
Cardenanthus), and a key to those species.
